title: [Self-Directed] Strategic Design for Competitive Behavior Development in Adolescent Tennis Athletes

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of tennis rules and coaching basics
context.additional_context: Professionals in corporate sports science research teams who require smartphone-based data access in resource-constrained technical environments

learning_goals: Analyzing the characteristics of the four stages (Red, Orange, Green, Full Ball) of Modified Tennis Training (MT) and explaining their impact on players' match behaviors
Designing optimal training strategies for each stage by comparing rally length, serve success rate, and shot type data measured by a notational analysis system

Developing customized training modules utilizing technical adaptation phenomena (e.g., extended rallies, increased forehand ratio) observed at a specific stage (MT Red) through project-based assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
